title: KernelExplainer for Multiclass XGBoost model - returns NaN Value Error

labels.name: bug
labels.description: Indicates an unexpected problem or unintended behaviour

body:
Hi - I love SHAP! So I have read that TreeExplainer does not currently handle Mutliclass XGBoost models with a 'probability' output type but thats what I'm trying to generate, so i'm trying to use SHAP with KernelExplainer. I have 3 classes and my input data for SHAP is a 100 row sample with no inf, -inf, or NaN. Ideally, I would see the SHAP plots add up to a probability of 1.0. 

However, I get this error: 

`ValueError: Input contains NaN, infinity or a value too large for dtype('float64').`

Here is a code snippet i'm working with: 
```
import shap

## kernel shap sends data as numpy array which has no column names, so we fix it
def xgb_predict(data_asarray):
    data_asframe =  pd.DataFrame(data_asarray, columns=X_train.columns)
    return model.predict(data_asframe)

explainer = shap.KernelExplainer(xgb_predict, link='logit', data=X_test.iloc[:100])
shap_values = explainer.shap_values(X_test.iloc[1])
shap.initjs()
shap.force_plot(explainer.expected_value[0], shap_values[0][0], X_test.iloc[1])
```

What am I doing wrong here? Is it the same issue as with TreeExplainer where the logit transform is not yet implemented in SHAP? Thank you!
